text: David fled from Naioth in Ramah. He came to Jonathan and asked, “What have I done? What is my offense? How have I sinned before your father, that he is seeking my life?”
Jonathan said to him, “By no means are you going to die! My father does nothing large or small without making me aware of it. Why would my father hide this matter from me? It just won’t happen!”

Taking an oath, David again said, “Your father is very much aware of the fact that I have found favor with you, and he has thought, ‘Don’t let Jonathan know about this, or he will be upset.’ But as surely as the Lord lives and you live, there is about one step between me and death!”
Jonathan replied to David, “Tell me what I can do for you.”
David said to Jonathan, “Tomorrow is the new moon, and I am certainly expected to join the king for a meal. You must send me away so I can hide in the field until the third evening from now.

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="06485" class="">happens to</st> <st data-num="06485" class="">miss</st> me, you should <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>, ‘<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="07592" class="">urgently</st> <st data-num="07592 04480">requested</st> me to <st data-num="07323" class="">let</st> him <st data-num="07323" class="">go</st><n id="1" /> to his <st data-num="05892" class="">town</st> <st data-num="01035" class="">Bethlehem</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> there is an <st data-num="03117" class="">annual</st> <st data-num="02077" class="">sacrifice</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st> for his <st data-num="03605" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="04940" class="">family</st>.’

<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> he should <st data-num="03541" class="">then</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">say</st>, ‘That’s <st data-num="02896" class="">fine</st>,’<n id="1" /> then your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> is <st data-num="07965" class="">safe</st>. But <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> he <st data-num="02734" class="">becomes</st> <st data-num="02734" class="">very</st> <st data-num="02734" class="">angry</st>, <st data-num="03045" class="">be assured</st> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">he</st> has <st data-num="03615" class="">decided</st> to <st data-num="07451" class="">harm</st> me.<n id="2" />
You must be loyal to your servant, for you have made a covenant with your servant in the Lord’s name. If I am guilty, you yourself kill me! Why bother taking me to your father?”
Jonathan said, “Far be it from you to suggest this! If I were at all aware that my father had decided to harm you, wouldn’t I tell you about it?”

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st>, “<st data-num="04310" class="">Who</st> will <st data-num="05046">tell</st> me <st data-num="0176 04100">if</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="06030" class="">answers</st> you <st data-num="07186" class="">harshly</st>?”

Jonathan said to David, “Come on. Let’s go out to the field.”

When the two of them had gone out into the field,

Jonathan said to David, “The Lord God of Israel is my witness! I will feel out my father about this time the day after tomorrow. If he is favorably inclined toward David, will I not then send word to you and let you know?

But if my father intends to do you harm, may the Lord do all this and more to Jonathan if I don’t let you know and send word to you, so you can go safely on your way. May the Lord be with you, as he was with my father.
While I am still alive, extend to me the loyalty of the Lord, or else I will die.
Don’t ever cut off your loyalty to my family, not even when the Lord has cut off every one of David’s enemies from the face of the earth

and <st data-num="01245 03068">called</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="0341" class="">enemies</st> <st data-num="03027" class="">to account</st>.” So <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="03772" class="">made a covenant</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> of <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="03254" class="">once again</st> <st data-num="07650" class="">took an oath with</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, because he <st data-num="0160" class="">loved</st> him. <st data-num="03588" class="">In fact</st> Jonathan <st data-num="0157" class="">loved</st> him as much as he <st data-num="0160" class="">did</st> his own <st data-num="05315" class="">life</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="04279" class="">Tomorrow</st> is the <st data-num="02320" class="">new moon</st>, and you will be <st data-num="06485" class="">missed</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> your <st data-num="04186" class="">seat</st> will <st data-num="06485" class="">be empty</st>.

On the <st data-num="07992" class="">third</st> day<n id="1" /> you should <st data-num="03381" class="">go down</st> <st data-num="03966" class="">quickly</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="0834 08033">where</st> you <st data-num="05641" class="">hid</st> yourself the <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> <st data-num="04639">this all started</st>.<n id="3" /> <st data-num="03427" class="">Stay</st> <st data-num="0681" class="">near</st> the <st data-num="068" class="">stone</st> <st data-num="0237" class="">Ezel</st>.

<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> will <st data-num="03384" class="">shoot</st> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="02678" class="">arrows</st> <st data-num="06654" class="">near</st> it, as though I were <st data-num="07971" class="">shooting</st> at a <st data-num="04307" class="">target</st>.

When I send a boy after them, I will say, ‘Go and find the arrows.’ If I say to the boy, ‘Look, the arrows are on this side of you; get them,’ then come back. For as surely as the Lord lives, you will be safe and there will be no problem.
But if I say to the boy, ‘Look, the arrows are on the other side of you,’ then get away. For in that case the Lord has sent you away.
With regard to the matter that you and I discussed, the Lord is the witness between us forever.”
So David hid in the field. When the new moon came, the king sat down to eat his meal.

The <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">sat down</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> his <st data-num="06471 06471">usual</st> <st data-num="04186" class="">place</st> <st data-num="0413 04186">by</st> the <st data-num="07023" class="">wall</st>, with <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="06923" class="">opposite</st> him<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03427" class="">and</st> <st data-num="074" class="">Abner</st> at <st data-num="07586" class="">his</st> <st data-num="06654" class="">side</st>.<n id="2" /> But <st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> was <st data-num="06485" class="">vacant</st>.

However, <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">said</st> <st data-num="03808 03972">nothing</st> about it<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he <st data-num="0559" class="">thought</st>,<n id="2" /> “<st data-num="01931" class="">Something</st> has <st data-num="04745" class="">happened</st> to make <st data-num="01931" class="">him</st> <st data-num="01115 02889">ceremonially unclean</st>. <st data-num="03588" class="">Yes</st>, he must be <st data-num="03808 02889">unclean</st>.”
But the next morning, the second day of the new moon, David’s place was still vacant. So Saul said to his son Jonathan, “Why has Jesse’s son not come to the meal yesterday or today?”
Jonathan replied to Saul, “David urgently requested that he be allowed to go to Bethlehem.

He said, ‘Permit me to go, for we are having a family sacrifice in the town, and my brother urged me to be there. So now, if I have found favor with you, let me go to see my brothers.’ For that reason he has not come to the king’s table.”
Saul became angry with Jonathan and said to him, “You stupid traitor! Don’t I realize that to your own disgrace and to the disgrace of your mother’s nakedness you have chosen this son of Jesse?
For as long as this son of Jesse is alive on the earth, you and your kingdom will not be established. Now, send some men and bring him to me. For he is as good as dead!”
Jonathan responded to his father Saul, “Why should he be put to death? What has he done?”

Then <st data-num="07586" class="">Saul</st> <st data-num="02904" class="">threw</st> his <st data-num="02595" class="">spear</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">at</st> Jonathan<n id="1" /> in order to <st data-num="05221" class="">strike</st> him <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st>. So <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">was convinced</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">that</st> his <st data-num="05973 01">father</st> had <st data-num="03617 01931">decided</st> to <st data-num="04191" class="">kill</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>.
Jonathan got up from the table enraged. He did not eat any food on that second day of the new moon, for he was upset that his father had humiliated David.
The next morning Jonathan, along with a young servant, went out to the field to meet David.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to his <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st>, “<st data-num="07323" class="">Run</st>, <st data-num="04672 04994">find</st> the <st data-num="02678" class="">arrows</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am about to <st data-num="03384" class="">shoot</st>.” As the <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="07323" class="">ran</st>, <st data-num="01931" class="">Jonathan</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03384" class="">shot</st> the <st data-num="02678" class="">arrow</st> <st data-num="05674" class="">beyond</st> him.

When the <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04725" class="">place</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">where</st> <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> had <st data-num="03384" class="">shot</st> the <st data-num="02678" class="">arrow</st>, <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="07121 0559">called out</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">to</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st>, “<st data-num="03808" class="">Isn’t</st> the <st data-num="02678" class="">arrow</st> <st data-num="01973" class="">farther</st> <st data-num="04480" class="">beyond</st> you?”

<st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">called out</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st>, “<st data-num="04120" class="">Hurry</st>! <st data-num="02363" class="">Go faster</st>! <st data-num="0408" class="">Don’t</st> <st data-num="05975" class="">delay</st>!” <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan’s</st> <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="03950" class="">retrieved</st> the <st data-num="02678" class="">arrow</st> and <st data-num="0935" class="">came back</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> his <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st>.

(Now the <st data-num="05288" class="">servant</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">understand</st> <st data-num="03972" class="">any of this</st>. <st data-num="0389" class="">Only</st> <st data-num="03083" class="">Jonathan</st> and <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">knew</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">what was going on</st>.)<n id="1" />
Then Jonathan gave his equipment to the servant who was with him. He said to him, “Go, take these things back to the town.”
When the servant had left, David got up from beside the mound, knelt with his face to the ground, and bowed three times. Then they kissed each other and they both wept, especially David.

Jonathan said to David, “Go in peace, for the two of us have sworn together in the name of the Lord saying, ‘The Lord will be between me and you and between my descendants and your descendants forever.’”

(21:1) Then David got up and left, while Jonathan went back to the town of Naioth.
